meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be reproduced.
meanings.sent1: The irreproducibilities of the ancient artifact made it impossible to create an exact copy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists encountered irreproducibilities when trying to recreate the experiment results.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the irreproducibilities of his unique sleight of hand.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic style had a touch of irreproducibilities that set her apart from other painters.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious phenomenon in the forest was full of irreproducibilities that baffled researchers.

meanings.definition: Instances or occurrences that cannot be replicated.
meanings.sent1: The scientist documented the irreproducibilities of the rare phenomenon.
meanings.sent2: The irreproducibilities in the data raised doubts about its accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show highlighted the irreproducibilities of the hilarious skit.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the irreproducibilities of nature in a stunning painting.
meanings.sent5: The detective was intrigued by the irreproducibilities of the mysterious case.
